job_history.work_description: Responsible for cultivating relationships and managing giving goals of 300 donors. Created individualized communication plans and giving goals for each donor as a benchmark marketing strategy. Ensured donors were properly acknowledged, personally thanked, and updated on the impact of their gifts. Worked with internal departments to secure appropriate project information and created offers and proposals that were used to secure gifts. Executed a specific plan to retain and upgrade donors. Used CRM systems, including Salesforce.

job_history.role_name: Team Leader for the Children of the World Choir
job_history.work_description: Led a team of 19 individuals including 13 children from the Philippines, Nepal, Honduras and Uganda during a 10-month tour across the United States. Directed multiple concerts per week for the International Children's Choir. Routinely coordinated concert details venues. Built professional relationships with partners across the United States. Responsible for communicating the vision and mission of World Help both on and off stage. Ensured safety and welfare of the children during extensive travel. Taught dance and instructed children throughout tour. Presented information about child sponsorship and humanitarian aid needs during concerts.

Increased student interest and participation in the classroom by creating and implementing thought-provoking hands-on activities. Bolstered student confidence and achievement through structured, data-driven remediation and enrichment lessons. Collaborated with colleagues to ensure the most effective instruction, practice, and assessments were implemented to successfully meet the needs of various learners. Established a behavior management system to foster a respectful classroom environment, reducing distractions and increasing learning time. Fostered meaningful relationships with students and parents to build trust and collaboration to better meet individual goals. Achieved 100% pass rate on Virginia Reading SOL test and 100% pass rate two years in a row on Virginia Math SOL test.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Demonstrated strong leadership skills by leading a team of 19 individuals, including children, during a 10-month tour across the United States, and also leading a team as a Donor Advocate.

skills.name: Communication
skills.explanation: Effectively communicated with donors, internal departments, and partners to secure gifts and project information, and also presented information about child sponsorship and humanitarian aid needs during concerts.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.explanation: Managed giving goals of 300 donors, created individualized communication plans, and executed a specific plan to retain and upgrade donors, demonstrating strong project management skills.

skills.name: Relationship Building
skills.explanation: Built professional relationships with partners across the United States, and also fostered meaningful relationships with students and parents to build trust and collaboration.

skills.name: Public Speaking
skills.explanation: Presented information about child sponsorship and humanitarian aid needs during concerts, demonstrating strong public speaking skills.

skills.name: Event Planning
skills.explanation: Coordinated concert details and venues, demonstrating a solid working proficiency in event planning.

skills.name: CRM Systems
skills.explanation: Used CRM systems, including Salesforce, to manage donor relationships, demonstrating a solid working proficiency in CRM systems.

skills.name: Teaching
skills.explanation: Increased student interest and participation in the classroom by creating and implementing thought-provoking hands-on activities, demonstrating strong teaching skills.

skills.name: Data Analysis
skills.explanation: Used data-driven remediation and enrichment lessons to bolster student confidence and achievement, demonstrating a solid working proficiency in data analysis.
